title: [BUG] Random app crashes in Visual Studio .NET Framework x86 project
body:
**Description**

Random app crashes in Visual Studio .NET Framework x86 project, no error at all, app just crashes ( in both VisualStudio and runtime), only thing we can get is from Windows Log with following, and the Faulting module is :clr.dll :

If change the project compile Target Platform to Any CPU or x64, works fine, seems crash happens in x86 only.

Faulting application name: WinformsFramework.exe, version: 1.0.0.0, time stamp: 0x8e2f1347
Faulting module name: clr.dll, version: 4.8.4300.0, time stamp: 0x5f7e61bb
Exception code: 0xc0000409
Fault offset: 0x0060cd78

Faulting application start time: 0x01d6ff2a3708d7a4
Faulting application path: D:\Code\V12 App\WinformsFramework\bin\x86\Debug\WinformsFramework.exe

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
Are you able to get some sort of repro or what was happening at the time?

Very weird that it fails in x86.

Maybe try Any CPU and set prefer 32 bits and see? Maybe there is something up with a 32-bit process.

comments.author: JackLi-tg
comments.body:
.NetCore project is fine, only .Net Framework project crashes.
using AnyCPU + prefer 32 bits crashes(same as x86).
Tried both 2.80.3-preview.40, still crashes.
